[@__scientist__] Heyecan verici bir etkinlik !!  @EmreSokullu Detaylar burada üëâüèª https://indieweb.org/2017/Istanbul (http://twtr.io/1Vmqms3AAmQ)
good afternoon #indieweb, I have a great generation 3/4 question to pass along:
"I need a new website... who should I work with??"
that's exactly the kind of question that I would really like to see both welcomed here and discussed here (in the main #indieweb channel)
(to be clear I think it's actually a pretty challenging question to answer well, given the spectrum of possibilities)
nonetheless, it's exactly the kind of user-centric question we should try to answer
tantek++ agreed
i (still) like the framing and q's at the top of https://indieweb.org/web_hosting . they help narrow down based on the individual situation
the whole page actually seems pretty decent. (we might want to tone down the tumblr recommendation, it's backslid a bit...but otherwise page content seems good.)
Yeah, with Yahoo at the helm of Tumblr the future seems iffy.
is there still a Yahoo? I thought the name was going to be changed to Oath
people will use both interchangeably for years to come
and not just future, tumblr's already gotten flakier over the last yr or so. see e.g. all the recent problems added on http://indieweb.org/wiki/index.php?title=Tumblr&action=history
also the new bad link rewriting, https://github.com/snarfed/bridgy/issues/609
[antipolar] #609 Tumblr Rewriting URLs
yeah that's good enough reason to de-emphasize Tumblr for any new websites for sure
it may (still?) be more usable, but has just enough frustrations / unreliability that it's likely to get more problematic, not less
snarfed, agreed that /web_hosting is a good start but I wonder how discoverable that is
what is a website
It looks like we don't have a page for "website" yet. Would you like to create it? https://indieweb.org/s/10sT

Hey Zegnat - will you attend IWC Istanbul ?

EmreSokullu tip: make sure to add IWC/HWC events to https://indieweb.org/events (have just done this for Istanbul). Now it will appear in the eMail http://indieweb.org/newsletter and at the Dortmund festival monitors it would show up under "next IWCs" ‚Ä¶
I'm writing a client-side web app that needs to be able to retrieve web pages (from arbitrary servers) and parse microformats2 from them
in general, CORS prevents you from being able to use AJAX

I‚Äôm sure this has been done before and is documented, just not sure where to look. I am going to set up 2 satellite blogs for specific content, and use my main domain as strictly notes/photos/checkins etc and be a public web profile/timeline. Can I add those sites to use for bridgy, indieauth, etc with my existing GitHub or Twitter login?
is there a hosted, publicly-usable API that will take an URL as input and return the microformats it finds?
bdesham: try microformats.io or xray.p3k.io

[miklb]: the relmeauth part will require that your twitter link to one site so you can't really use it with multiple domains. But your secondary domains could link to a secondary IndieAuth server like selfauth
aaronpk: hmm. microformats.io doesn't seem to issue the CORS headers I'd need, and X-Ray doesn't find my h-adr data :-|
aaronpk thanks. I‚Äôll take a look. It‚Äôs actually been awhile since I‚Äôve set up indieauth/bridgy stuff I don‚Äôt remember what is entailed. Probably a good exercise.
bdesham: yeah XRay is a little more than a parser
I'm pretty pleased with this multi-rsvp to the original event on the domain of the theater, the FB POSSE copy, and their tweet about it: http://tantek.com/2017/247/t1/going-to-serenity-movie-party
[Tantek √áelik] going to Serenity Movie Party tonight 19:00 @DrafthouseSF!
https://drafthouse.com/sf/show/syfy-presents-serenity-movie-party
no webmention support at drafthouse.com but Falcon called the Twitter API to thread the RSVP to their announcement tweet, and used Bridgy to RSVP to the FB event.
http://atomenabled.org/ expired üò¢
bdesham: you can use e.g. https://anyorigin.com/ to get CORS headers on any site
Good Morning IndieWeb
Now here's a silo tax https://medium.com/@BenRegenspan/why-16-of-the-code-on-the-average-site-belongs-to-facebook-and-what-that-means-68956cd731be

[kevinmarks] the truly sad aspect is that current frontend devs consider the extra 200KB js percetly fine, because it's cached, not even remotely considering, that caching is only a network relief - it's still eating memory and cpu for breakfast.
I'm astonished how js devs believe ludicrously size js is fine
imagine what 200KB of C code can do...

it looks like my Skype account was deleted
what is Skype
Skype is a communication service that provides text chat, and audio/video calling service via native applications on desktop (Mac, Windows), and mobile (iOS, Android) https://indieweb.org/Skype
the last notification I got from them via email was 2016-08-02
and now their sign-in UI claims "That Microsoft account doesn't exist. Enter a different account or get a new one."
a-ha I found https://a.login.skype.com/diagnostics
"You have 1 Skype account(s) for ... Select your account then sign in or reset your password."
wow looks like lots of people's skype accounts were hacked and used to send URLs to spam or other nasty things
if you have a Skype account I recommend changing your pw

Meaning its "premium."
If you visit it, it's a wordpress.

let me dig the info out, one sec
oh, sorry, misread
